answers.answer: I have the exact same thing. Pressure behind the eyes when laying down. What could this be?

I'd be really concerned about eye pressure problems...Obviously there is something going on...Do you have glaucoma? Diabetes? Suspicion of a sinus cavity tumor?  Problems with plaque in your neck vessels? Ever had a  MRA (brain vessel scan) scan of your head to make sure you don't have a problem with the blood vessels under the front of your brain? This sounds a lot like glaucoma, but I am no expert...If you haven't, I'd at least see an eye doc...

I have been experiencing something similar for years.  When I lay down I get this very sudden throbbing pressure in my head, top of my head down into my forehead.  Sounds are actually mufled & amplified with the throbbing.  It goes from the point of annoyance to painful quickly and then hangs on for 10-30 seconds.  It does go away, though.  It doesn't happen every time, but it happens when I lay down on my stomach.  Anyone experiencing this or have ideas??

To revy, I get something similar to that usually every once in awhile when i lay on my side i feel my blood vessel throbbing at a point where i must stop laying down for a moment.  Its more of a throbbing on the side of my forehead than a pain

question: Please let me know if you have any advice or ideas about what this could be:Symptoms have occured for almost 3 years-A quick, intense build up of pressure behind the eyes when laying down-pressure increases when turned on stomach-pressure increases when pressure is applied to the body, ie tight clothing, pets on lap, etc-pressure increases when accelerating quickly or going high speeds in a vehicle-pressure lasts until stimulous is taken away, ie changing positions or standing up, putting on loose clothing-Visual issues-verticle polarized looking streaks in vision that fade in and out almost with heart rate-streaks are mostly noticed when in bright light and walking-visual snow when looking at the sky-muscles in eyes often feel sore or like they are not working right (also if remain in a horizontal position where pressure behind the eyes is increased overnight, wake up with a severe feeling of soreness behind the eyes)- blood pressure generally in the low 90s/60sMRI showed no problemsct scan of sinus showed no problemsmigraine meds of no helpAny response will be appreciated!
title: Pressure behind eyes when laying down
